definitions.definition: To drone like certain insects naturally do in motion, or sounding similarly
To buzz, be busily active like a beehive
definitions.example: The streets were humming with activity.

definitions.definition: To produce low sounds which blend continuously
To reek, smell bad.
definitions.example: This room really hums — have you ever tried spring cleaning, mate?

definitions.definition: To flatter by approving; to cajole; to deceive or impose upon; to humbug.
A sweater that must be put on by pulling it over the head; a sweater without buttons or a zipper in front
An exercise performed lying on the back in which the arms are extended behind the head and exertion lifts the weight above the head.
(horizontal bar) An exercise in which the gymnast pulls up from a hang lifting the legs up and over the bar thus rolling into a support position.
An instance of a vehicle being pulled over.
To cut into or between; to cut or cross mutually; to divide into parts.
definitions.example: Any two diameters of a circle intersect each other at the centre.

definitions.definition: Of two sets, to have at least one element in common.
In an exhaustive manner.
(of animals) To return to its owner.
definitions.example: The dog homed.

definitions.definition: (always with "in on") To seek or aim for something.
definitions.example: The missile was able to home in on the target.

definitions.definition: To move out of a dwelling, either by choice or by eviction.
definitions.example: I have to vacate my house by midday, as the new owner is moving in.

definitions.definition: To leave an office or position.
definitions.example: He vacated his coaching position because of the corruption scandal.

definitions.definition: To have a court judgement set aside; to annul.
definitions.example: The judge vacated the earlier decision when new evidence was presented.

definitions.definition: To leave an area, usually as a result of orders from public authorities in the event of a riot or natural disaster.
definitions.example: If you do not immediately vacate the area, we will make you leave with tear gas!

definitions.definition: An escape from prison.
An escape from any restrictive or confining situation.
An outbreak.
A breakdown of statistics; a detailed view of component parts.
A room in a hotel etc. that can be taken by a smaller group at a large conference.

An inflammatory nodule found in many diseases, consisting of histiocytes (macrophages) attempting to wall off substances they perceive as foreign but are unable to eliminate, such as certain infectious organisms as well as other materials such as suture fragments
(medicine, less specific) any small nodule
A cage to keep pet or zoological specimen birds in.
A game of chance played with dice; chuck-a-luck.
The repetition of an earlier (usually historic) event, as a performance or social event.
definitions.example: They're going to the Civil War battle reenactment this weekend.

definitions.definition: A bluish-green pigment made from chromium sesquioxide.
(color) A bluish-green color.
(colour) Of a bluish green colour.
A stupid person; a blockhead, a dolt.
A metal tool consisting of a long rod with a bulbous end that is made hot in a fire, then plunged into some material (such as pitch or a liquid) to melt or heat it.
A post on a whaling boat used to secure the harpoon rope.
(often in the plural) A thistle-like flowering plant of the genus Centaurea, particularly the common knapweed (Centaurea nigra).
Used as the name of various animals with large heads.
To flinch as if in pain or distress.
To wash (cloth), dip it in dye, etc., with the use of a wince.
To kick or flounce when unsteady or impatient.
definitions.example: A horse winces.

definitions.definition: A vacation.
A vacuum cleaner.
